author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Spain’s ballot, a choice awaits, in maelstrom’s center there it baits,
A turn to right, a shift of tides, where Europe’s path, Spain’s fate now rides.
Yet, Teutonic shades cast their doubt, in this saga, outcome’s stout,
Thus, Thor’s hammer seeks its swain, in the vast checkered field of Spain.

In distant realm of Ukraine bold, tale of strife and valor told,
Lack of armament and might, blunts the edge of warriors' fight.
Yet, in spite of gaping void, a defiance they've deployed,
Against the Rus, they hold firm, like rowan shield in thunderstorm.

To avert the fear of age, an outliving of coin's gauge,
Retirement's break tax doth offer, a silken hammock to the coffer.
Balancing this promenade, between the crone and fiery god,
A longevity annuity they've sold, to ensure the old gold's hold.

feedItems.title: Spain Votes in Election That Could Signal Shift to the Right
feedItems.description: Spaniards cast ballots in an uncertain election that will determine whether the country follows others in Europe in taking a sharp turn to the right.

feedItems.title: Ukraine's Lack of Weaponry and Training Risks Stalemate in Fight With Russia
feedItems.description: U.S. and Ukraine knew of shortfalls in training and weapons, but Kyiv still launched offensive.

feedItems.title: A Retirement Tax Break That Ends the Fear of Outliving Your 401(k)
feedItems.description: The pros and cons of using your nest egg to buy a special longevity annuity in retirement.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
As Moscow doth oil aflow, to scorn the cap,
Their purse swells, though sanctions trap.
Lessened half, their gains did show,
Now seem' to rise from 'neath the blow.

Discover trails, seek ye delight,
Tech shall guide you true and right.
Mark well your path and save thy life,
Lest ye stumble in nature's strife.

Watch now, the drugmen of the West,
Their movements tip the Euro's rest.
Through ropes of tax, they weave their lot,
Affecting Europe, they careth not.

feedItems.title: Russia Defies Sanctions by Selling Oil Above Price Cap
feedItems.description: Higher prices could bolster Moscow’s oil-export revenues, which last month dropped to just over half their level from a year ago.

feedItems.title: This Tech Will Help Find Your Next Hike---and Can Save Your Life
feedItems.description: Discover new trails, download maps to access offline and don’t forget a battery pack.

feedItems.title: How U.S. Drug Companies Could Tip Europe Into Recession
feedItems.description: Swings in Ireland’s pharmaceutical industry, often rooted in tax moves by U.S.-based firms, have outsize impact on European output.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Once lay barren, an uncobbled road,
Now dances upon the golden abode,
A southern soiree, where hearts enfold,
Beneath the stars, tales of love are told.

Trading of brushes and kinsmen's food,
Where coin is sparse, the humble brood,
Time unyielding, the wheel elude,
In love’s pursuit, not wealth allude.

Upon the stage, their narratives unfurled,
Barbie and Oppenheimer, a tale swirled,
In twinned showing, dreams world to world,
As love drawn curtain, once again is twirled.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: Not long ago, it was an unpaved stretch of highway. Now it's "the Hamptons of the South."

feedItems.title: Chinese Consumers Pinch Pennies on Staples as Pandemic Habits Linger
feedItems.description: The average selling prices of toothbrushes, infant formula and makeup are declining as businesses adapt to circumstances.

feedItems.title: 'Barbenheimer' Is Here: Moviegoers Turn Out for 'Barbie' and 'Oppenheimer'
feedItems.description: Movie fans flocked to theaters for the release of “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer,” with some seeing the films back-to-back. Hollywood is hoping the summer blockbuster odd couple can give a boost to the box office.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In the quest for power's gain, the land doth shake,
But Cobalt mine lies still, no bounty take.
In chain of battery, Chinese rule is found,
Whilst the U.S. in their shadow, is bound.

Billions cast on Texan soil so grand,
To guard a border, issue of the land.
Yet security proves a beast untamed,
Their efforts seem in vain, and to be blamed.

In January's sixth day, an echo lingers,
Of counsel's court and pointing fingers.
The Trumpet's song may hold a sour note,
As he seeks again the presidential boat.

feedItems.title: The Energy Transition Will Require Cobalt. America's Only Mine Can't Get Off the Ground.
feedItems.description: The U.S. is playing catch-up in battery supply chains dominated by China.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: Texas spent billions on the most aggressive attempt by any state to take over border security. It hasn’t worked.

feedItems.title: A Guide to a Possible Trump Jan. 6 Indictment
feedItems.description: A look at what we know about the special counsel’s potential case and the others former President Donald Trump faces as he fights to win the Republican 2024 presidential nomination.
